title: 3 people injured after daytime shooting in Mattapan, police say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Crime Two men were hospitalized with non-life-threatening injuries, and a woman was hospitalized with “serious” injuries, police said.
By Darin Zullo October 12, 2025 | 9:54 AM 1 minute to read Three people were hospitalized after they were injured Saturday afternoon in a shooting in Mattapan, according to Boston police.
Officers responded to 2 Hiawatha Road shortly after 1 p.

title: Boston judge orders release of 13-year-old boy from ICE custody
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Local News The boy is allegedly being held with unrelated adult men, and no reason has been given for his detainment, according to the order.
By Darin Zullo October 12, 2025 | 9:43 AM 1 minute to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

A federal judge in Boston has ordered Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) to release a 13-year-old boy who was arrested and is being held in Burlington at the agency’s temporary holding facility.

title: Bruins improve to 3-0 on the season after stifling Sabres offense Saturday
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Boston Bruins Boston's defense held Buffalo to just one shot on goal in the first period.
The Bruins slowed Buffalo's offense to a halt on Saturday.
(AP Photo/Michael Dwyer) The Bruins defense made a statement in their 3-1 win over the Sabres on Saturday night.

title: Patriots elevate RB Terrell Jennings ahead of Week 6 matchup vs. Saints
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: New England Patriots With Antonio Gibson out for the season, Jennings could make his season debut on Sunday.
The Patriots elevated Terrell Jennings in place of Antonio Gibson on Sunday.
(Barry Chin/Globe Staff) The Patriots are elevating a pair of practice squad players ahead of their matchup with the Saints on Sunday.

title: Why Alex Cora is remaining positive about Alex Bregman amid star 3B’s uncertain future with Red Sox
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Red Sox "He chose us last year for the right reasons.
" Alex Cora was a key reason why Alex Bregman signed with the Red Sox last offseason.
(Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche October 11, 2025 | 4:21 PM 2 minutes to read Alex Cora is refusing to let himself get worried about Alex Bregman’s future in Boston.

title: Judd Sirott, Andy Brickley begin second season together in NESN’s Bruins booth after ‘seamless’ transition last year
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Boston Bruins Brickley said things were different last year without Jack Edwards in the booth, but he has a good connection with Sirott.
The puck drop last week on a second season in the NESN booth for Judd Sirott and Andy Brickley.

title: Bill Belichick appears to call Kirk Herbstreit during ‘College GameDay’ segment about UNC’s struggles
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots "He probably has something to say.
" Bill Belichick has gotten out to a 2-3 start at UNC.

(AP Photo/Chris Seward) By Conor Roche October 11, 2025 | 3:09 PM 2 minutes to read Bill Belichick was either dialed into ESPN’s “College GameDay” or he inadvertently made an awkward live television moment on Saturday morning.

title: Is Drake Maye a top-10 QB yet? Experts believe he’s close, if he isn’t already
author: Conor Roche

Drake Maye showed out in the Patriots' upset win over the Bills.

title: 5 things to know about the Saints before they face the Patriots on Sunday
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Saints' offensive talent is subpar, but their defensive front could present the Patriots with some problems.
